intro: Aciotis indecora var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth aciotis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, glabrous surface. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. This variant is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to other varieties of Aciotis.
